snippet: A criminal complaint unsealed in Manhattan says the Russians, who are protected by diplomatic immunity, illegally obtained $1.5 million in benefits.
lead_paragraph: A criminal complaint unsealed in Manhattan says the Russians, who are protected by diplomatic immunity, illegally obtained $1.5 million in benefits.
abstract: Criminal complaint unsealed in Manhattan says Russian diplomats posted to New York City, and their wives, fraudulently applied for $1.5 million in Medicaid benefits over past nine years, while protected by diplomatic immunity; prosecutors characterize scheme as audacious swindle of federal health benefits program for needy, orchestrated by officials in the Russian Consulate in New York and its mission to the United Nations.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Moscow, and Alex Vadukul from New York.
